oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-page handwritten letter from Ammons to his family. He describes returning to his company's Lai Khe Base Camp from Close Infantry Combat (C.I.C) training to find the company had two men killed and two wounded in an ambush. The unit had suffered the loss of half its men approximately six months prior.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia in 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
